resources.string: The road north is dangerous and filled with many pitfalls. I<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> advise you take some friends, it is not a place to go alone.
Oh, hey, did they capture you too? Don't worry, we'll get out of here soon.
It's a bit too cold up here for liking. Give<g id="grace_spreadarms" /> me the warm rains of Ireland any day!
Hm. You<g id="yonas_beckon" /> made it through the blockade. Did you see our supplies?
How does it look out there? The Corrupted patrols keep coming by.
The cold, the Corrupted; there's nothing good about this place.
We made it through. Many of our number gave everything to see that we did.
I feel guilty getting here when so many others did not.
Get it off!
Destroy it!
I am grateful<g id="male_bowShallow" /> to have you returned, Soulwarden.<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> Hasty decisions have been made, and we need your insight.
But I know you've just returned<g id="female_youknow" /> from the Fen - has Morgaine agreed to join our cause?
"Yes, she will come here in time."
I shall endeavor to put<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> aside my grievances against the sorceress,<g id="female_explainS" /> our circumstances demand it.
I apologize<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> for my abrupt departure. I hoped to strategize with Yonas, but he was already quite set on a plan of his own making.
"Not surprised. Where is he?"
He's been gone<g id="male_explain" /> for some time now. I had asked him to wait, but he refused.
He had become<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" /> deeply suspicious about the enemy's activities to the north, convinced they plotted some terrible campaign.
Through the Gates of Great Cleave
Recover supplies being shipped through the blockade and rescue the Wardens who accompanied the delivery.
Assault the Gates and reclaim supplies for the Outpost
Defeat the Corrupted
Repair the Supply Wagon
Fill the Supply Wagon
Recover the Food Crate
Recover the Armor Crate
Recover the Weapon Crate
Repair and Fill the Supply Wagon
Inform Galahad about the supplies
Search for Captured Soulwarden Scouts in {POITags}
Defeat Corrupted Workers
Rescue Yash Zafar
Rescue Judithe Owens
Rescue Pedro Carrillo
Travel to the Outpost to meet up with the other Soulwardens
Scouts from<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> Great Cleave reported the rise of some new, fell Commander within the ranks of the Corrupted.
They had also witnessed enemy troops engaged<g id="female_explainS" /> in the preparation of siege equipment. Yonas felt action was demanded.
"I can understand that."

<g id="grace_gestureLeftM" />There is an old outpost in the foothills to the Northeast, and Yonas<g id="female_youknowS" /> resolved that he and a handful of Wardens would push through enemy lines and capture it.
I suggested that task be left to you, but<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> he refused to wait.
"Did they capture the outpost?"
Yes, fortunately. A scout<g id="female_swayBored" /> returned with news Yonas had secured the outpost but was in desperate need of supplies.
I dispatched carts of food and ammunition, but<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" /> they were intercepted trying to get around enemy lines.
"Then we should recover them."
I agree, but our secret passage into<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" /> Great Cleave is lost. We have no choice now but to charge the gates.
<g id="grace_gesturebothhands" />I suggest we split up, assault the gate, recover<g id="male_quidproquo" /> what supplies we can and meet north of the front. Godspeed to us both.
We must<g id="male_clenchFistRight" /> recover those supplies for the outpost.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />I managed to recover but a few crates of supplies - I am glad to see you<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" /> met with greater success, and repaired the cart as well!
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />Now, there's just the matter<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> of the unfortunate scouts who fell to ambush.
"I didn't see any sign of them."
<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Hm, neither did I. I suspect the Corrupted marched the captives off to one<g id="male_pointLeft" /> of their work camps to the north.
We can only hope<g id="female_explainS" /> their Heartgems protected them and they have not fallen.<g id="female_smackfist" /> We must attempt rescue.
"I'll rescue them."
I humbly<g id="male_bowShallow" /> acquiesce to your orders, Soulwarden. To be honest,<g id="female_youknowS" /> it's a relief not to bear the burden of command.
<g id="male_nodMild" />Nonetheless, if I reach the outpost and you<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> do not follow soon, I will circle back. That, you cannot prevent.
I do wish<g id="male_lookupSmall" /> Yonas had listened to my counsel. We might've avoided this.
Now there is a face that renews my hope… or did they capture you too?
Don't worry! I have a plan! Or… I did. I hadn't expected them to have hounds. We might need a new plan.
"I'll handle the hounds."
The way is clear? Amazing. I suppose this is why Yonas holds you in such high esteem. Well deserved, it seems.
But I cannot leave without the others. I swore to them I would get them out of this mess.
"I'll do that. You go."
This sounds like an order, and you are, of course, a superior within the Wardens, so I will obey.
Let it be known that I do so under protest, however. I should like to have aided in rescuing the others. Next time, I guess.
I'll get to the road and wait there for the others. I can't return to Yonas without them.
We were told that supply passage was secure, but the Corrupted waited there in ambush. I saw that Yonas managed to fight his way out - did he make it to the outpost?
"Yes, and you should go join him."
Those are welcome tidings. I had feared our time as Soulwardens was going to be short-lived. Perhaps we have a chance against the Corrupted, after all.
The next time, we'll be more prepared. Those Corrupted won't take us again so easily.
Please tell me you have a better plan than Yash. I don't doubt his enthusiasm, but his plan to rescue us got him caught too!
"Head to the outpost."
I guess that's straightforward enough. I tried to run twice before, and they weren't too gentle bringing me back. Here's hoping third time brings me luck!
I can't believe we made it. With you here, we might just be able to hold this place.
You made it through! I'm glad to see you, but many<g id="yonas_handsHipsShakehead" /> others were not as fortunate. Our first priority is rescuing those who were captured.
<g id="male_nodMild" />When I saw Galahad coming up the road with those supplies, I<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" /> couldn't believe it! And now the rescue of our captured Wardens as well.
The outpost needed<g id="yonas_spreadarms001" /> supplies and reinforcements and now we have both!
"An outpost behind enemy lines."
Yes, I deemed<g id="yonas_shrugDontcare" /> that was necessary based on the reports from<g id="yonas_shiftWeight" /> our scouts. Ominous activities are under way here.
<g id="yonas_realize" />This new Commander among the Corrupted maneuvers with<g id="yonas_rightfist" /> a confidence that only comes from an unbeatable strategy.
It doesn't look like you have good news, you'd better get to Yonas to tell him what you know.
I turned around and it was too late, half my group had already been captured. My only chance to help them was to push on and get reinforcements.
Secrets in the Ruins
Visit the Ancient Ruins to find out what the Corrupted have been after.
Travel to {POITags} to find what the Corrupted want
Climb up the central pillar of {POITags}
Continue climbing the central pillar
Reach the top of the central pillar
Defeat {targetName}
Read the abandoned note
Collect the {itemname} from the upper fountain
Return to {POITags}
(Optional) Use the Spirit Shrine
Many of the Corrupted's<g id="yonas_explain02" /> most elite units have been pulled back from the front lines and redeployed to protect other activities.
This Commander seems<g id="yonas_leftfist" /> to be in pursuit of some secret within the Ancient Ruins.
"Whatever it is, it can't be good."
<g id="yonas_lefthand" />My thoughts exactly,<g id="yonas_headshakeDisappointed" /> and that is why I deemed the capture of this outpost to be of critical importance.
Securing this<g id="yonas_gestureAround" /> location has been priority, however. We haven't been able to investigate the Commander's new efforts.
"I'll do it. You hold the outpost."
A solid<g id="yonas_noddingSubtle" /> plan. Galahad<g id="yonas_righthand02" /> and I will look at ways to secure a broader swath of the territory.
Search the ruins<g id="yonas_pointRight" /> to the south. Our scouts saw the Commander's forces there.<g id="yonas_shrug" /> We need to know what they were doing.
If this Commander gets his<g id="yonas_headshakeDisappointed" /> hands on some Ancient source of power, all could be lost.
Any moment now, I fear<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> we'll see an army of the Corrupted marching this way. We can't afford to sit and wait for them.
Our ranks swell, and now we call upon allies from beyond. Our victory is assured.
Our ranks swell, and now we call upon allies from beyond.
Our victory is assured.

The Ancients knew very well the power of Corruption far outstripped their own, but such gifts were reserved for humanity, and they brought only disaster upon themselves.

This is the hour long awaited, this is the moment we marshal the resources promised us...

and assume command of the greatest military force the world has ever known.

Your arrival is well-timed.<g id="male_sighRelief" /> Our scouts have just returned with excellent news<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> - the forces of the Corrupted are vulnerable as they've spread out.
Did you manage<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> to discover what strategy this Commander pursues?
"They're summoning inhuman allies."
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />Beyond those already augmenting their ranks? I shudder<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" /> to think of whatever demons might be at their disposal from beyond.
It seems Yonas may<g id="female_crossarms" /> have been right about the urgency of the situation, after all.
Assessing the Enemy
Join Yonas at one of the forts, get past its defenses, and discover how the Corrupted plan on contacting the source of Corruption.
Travel to {POITags} to find news of the Corrupted Commander
Meet with Yonas
Destroy the barricades
Destroy the second barricade
Destroy the third barricade
Chop the cannon to pieces
Defeat {targetName}
Search Sunderfort for clues about Thorpe's plans
Search Sunderfort for clues about Thorpe's plans
Find evidence of Thorpe's plans
Find more evidence of Thorpe's plans
Read Thorpe's Journal
Return to Yonas via Sunderfort's gate
Our discovery<g id="male_gestureHereweare" /> may in fact be tied to what you learned in the ruins.<g id="female_explainS" /> We stumbled upon a massive mining operation in the canyon to the west.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />We assumed they sought more pure Azoth, but<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> this operation is too large.
"They're constructing something."
Yes, and the sooner<g id="female_leftfistThreaten" /> we can dismantle their efforts, the better.
There is only<g id="male_explain" /> one fortification protecting their work in the canyon.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> It is formidable, but it cannot be avoided.
"A direct assault, then?"
As mad as it sounds, that<g id="female_gestureForward02" /> seems to be the best gamble.<g id="female_explainS" /> Yonas has gone ahead to assess the fort's vulnerabilities.
I can stay<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> to keep the outpost secure. You should join Yonas in the canyon and formulate a plan of attack.
Ironically, though we have far fewer soldiers than we had during the Wars of Crimson Madness, I<g id="male_nodProud" /> believe we may yet have a chance of victory in all this.
If we can disable<g id="female_smackfist" /> the Corrupted operations in the canyon, we must then look to push further north.
<g id="yonas_shrugDontcare" />Whatever this new Commander of the Corrupted is plotting, we may have the chance<g id="yonas_gestureDown" /> to put an end to it here and now.
<g id="yonas_realize" />The Commander is here in the Sunderfort…<g id="yonas_crossarmsLeanback" /> it seems he goes by the name of Thorpe.
"Thorpe? I came here on his ship."
<g id="yonas_shrug" />Ah, a story begins<g id="yonas_thinking" /> to unfold… the fact he is a new leader among the Corrupted… it makes sense.
<g id="yonas_lefthand" />While you have worked to become a Soulwarden and defend<g id="yonas_handsHipsShakehead" /> against Corruption, your Captain has taken a much darker path.
"He was cruel before the Corruption."
There are moments<g id="yonas_wagFinger" /> of coincidence, and moments that are not. I believe this is the latter.
I have urged<g id="yonas_lookrightPensive" /> you against charging into danger, but you've never been one for caution. Go on then, and light be with you.

Here I come full circle, from laboring in the mines on behalf of our mistress, to now being in command of the entire operation. 

I shall bring new purpose to this enterprise as well. To the mistress, the motes of that infernal Azoth, but to me, the materials to construct the designs of the Ancients. 

History will be made here in Great Cleave.

The mistress is displeased with the fact we've found so little of the pure Azoth she seeks, but when I shared of our accomplishments towards my plan, I could see that I have once again proved to her that I am the one who can deliver this victory.

She's wisely committed even more of our forces to the cause. The ore flows like a river up to the summit. 

I will soon bask in the glory of my success.

Isabella has now become extremely interested in our enterprise here in Great Cleave, and where I hoped to only construct a handful of the Felportals, she has expanded the plan to include many more.

The final stonework for our first structure at the summit nears completion, and I will now leave this operation to my lieutenants and ascend to ensure the rituals are planned to perfection. The strength and pride I feel for this work makes up for whatever regrets I may have for my time in the Old World.

This was my destiny all along.

string.comment: All Thorpe IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Captain Thorpe
string.name: CaptainThorpe

resources.string: I was your Captain once… until you betrayed me on the beach. Now, I have one final order… walk away. Disobey me, and you will be destroyed.
I was your Captain once…
Until you betrayed me on the beach.
Now, I have one final order…
Walk. Away.
Disobey me, and you will be destroyed.
<g id="yonas_righthand02" />While the forces of the Corrupted are spread across the region, the Sunderfort appears to be well defended. Be<g id="yonas_fisthigh" /> careful, young Warden.
"Thorpe mentioned an 'Isabella'?"

<g id="yonas_headtilthmm" />Isabella… that name<g id="yonas_thinking" /> has not been spoken in a long time.<g id="yonas_lefthand" /> Perhaps this is the Tempest? How curious that Thorpe knows her given name.
You<g id="yonas_laughXl" /> charged into the fort and against a small army, and now you return unscathed. That alone is quite a feat.
But what<g id="yonas_noddingheadApproval" /> of your former Captain, this Commander Thorpe, was he there? Did you confront him?
"Yes, but Thorpe got away."

<g id="yonas_lefthand" />Hm. I wonder if he has departed to oversee some<g id="yonas_lookleftPensive" /> other aspect of the operation. With all this ore they've mined, they must be taking it somewhere.
Do we<g id="yonas_gestureForward" /> know to what end all this work is being done?
"To summon an army of Corrupted."
I see… As<g id="yonas_crossarmsLeanback" /> I recall, there were some true demons among the Corrupted in the last war;<g id="yonas_shrug" /> we often pondered their origins.
But these were few<g id="yonas_shiftWeight" /> and far between;<g id="yonas_realize" /> if Commander Thorpe summoned an army, our cause would be lost.
Sabotage the Supply Chain
Assault the mines to cripple Thorpe's mining operation.
Travel to {POITags} to disrupt Thorpe's mining operation
(Optional) Fire the cannon to enter the mines
Get inside the mining complex
Destroy the southern ore cart
Destroy the eastern ore cart
Destroy the northern ore cart
Destroy the western ore cart
Defeat {targetName}
Take the upper path to meet up with Yonas.
<g id="yonas_realize" />If Commander Thorpe is constructing<g id="yonas_explain02" /> some portal into hell, we should move quickly to discover where this infernal thing is being built.
But we must shut<g id="yonas_clenchfistsEager" /> down this mine first. We should summon more Wardens from the Outpost.
"There's no time. I'll do it."
Bah!<g id="yonas_throwarmsFrustrated" /> You're as bull-headed now as the day I met you, but my strength is renewed and I will not stand idly by.
One<g id="yonas_spreadarms001" /> of us should attempt to track where the ore carts are going, while the other disables the mine.
"I'll assault the mine."
<g id="yonas_shiftWeight" />Very well, I'll leave the brute force tasks to you...<g id="yonas_shrugDontcare" /> for the moment, at least.
We've scouted<g id="yonas_lookaroundCasual" /> the east road, so the ore must be going west. Destroy the mining operation and then look for me on the mountain road. Good luck.
I suspect these portals<g id="yonas_leftfist" /> they're building may be on the high peaks to the west. We will see.
You see the brilliance of our plans…? There is time yet for you to join the side of righteousness.
You see the brilliance of our plans…?
There is time yet for you to join the side of righteousness.
Oof,<g id="yonas_handsHipsShakehead" /> it seems the Corrupted have reinforced their defenses on the bridge.

<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Yonas is rather cross with me, but<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" /> I stand by my decision. We have a chance to establish a foothold in this region,<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> and we cannot afford to squander it.
<g id="yonas_lefthand" />I heard the fire of cannons and<g id="yonas_suppressLaugh" /> hoped that had been something you did, rather than something aimed at you.
Since you<g id="yonas_gestureForward" /> are standing before me, I'm guessing the mission was a success?<g id="yonas_realize" /> That's at least one piece of good news.
"Were you able to follow the ore?"
<g id="yonas_righthand02" />Only this far. The Corrupted are now maneuvering<g id="yonas_headshakeDisappointed" /> against us - they've fortified their defenses on the bridge to the western rim.
Their carts<g id="yonas_lefthand" /> are - or were - ferrying ore across,<g id="yonas_shiftWeight" /> so that's where the trail leads.
All Part of the Plan
Fight your way across the bridge, meet with Yash, and disable the forts on your way to the western outpost.
Learn Galahad's Plan
Travel across {POITags} to break the Corrupted blockade
Chop through the first barricade
Chop through the second barricade
Chop through the third barricade
Damage the first cannon
(Optional) Rotate the second cannon
(Optional) Use the cannon against the Corrupted
Defeat {targetName}
Share intel with Yash
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Find more of Thorpe's plans
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Find more of Thorpe's plans
It seems Galahad<g id="yonas_handsHipsShakehead" /> sent Warden Yash across to scout another outpost.<g id="yonas_lefthand" /> With the bridge now reinforced, he is cut off.
Galahad's poor<g id="yonas_waghandDisagree02" /> judgment aside, I'm worried. Yash has heroic aspirations,<g id="yonas_shrug" /> but not enough experience.
"We need to get across the bridge."
Yes,<g id="yonas_nod" /> I am prepared to make the assault whenever you are,<g id="yonas_realize" /> but speak to Galahad first and at least<g id="yonas_shrug" /> hear out the bright knight's plan.
Though I wish<g id="yonas_lookup" /> he had conferred with us first, I admit that his reasoning is sound.
If we are to have any hope of stopping the Corrupted, we need to take<g id="yonas_gestureDown" /> back control of the bridge.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I know Yonas is displeased with my decision<g id="female_explainS" /> to scout the western outpost, but I stand by it.
<g id="male_nodMild" />We have a chance to establish<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> a foothold in this region, and we should make an effort to take advantage of it.
"It was a risk, but worth trying."
And I have no<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> intention of backing down on the plan. I obviously did not intend for Yash to be cut off,<g id="female_smackfist" /> but I stand ready to make amends.
Lead the charge<g id="male_gestureForwardRighthand" /> across the bridge, Soulwarden. Yonas and I will follow.
Lead on, Soulwarden! Let's break<g id="female_leftfistThreaten" /> through this barricade, find Warden Yash, and secure a new position from where we can strike back against the crimson menace.

Aha! I was hoping<g id="female_cheerFistpump" /> to run into you!<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Well, Commander Yonas, really, but you'll do!<g id="female_explainS" /> On Galahad's orders, I've scouted the outpost up the hill.
The<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" /> Corrupted block the road, but it appears to be a secure location.
"Good work. Is it well-defended?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Not the outpost; but they patrol it from<g id="male_pointLeft" /> the nearby forts. We'll need to put those forts on the defensive.
I was<g id="male_secretive" /> working myself up to stage an the attack alone, but...<g id="male_nodMild" /> I think your presence improves the chances of success.
"Fall back. I'll get the forts."

Oh, well, there are just<g id="female_whattheheck" /> a few Corrupted on the road… the forts<g id="female_smackfist" /> are where the action is, but… alright,<g id="male_nod1" /> I realize you may be better suited.
I'll wait<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> until you make your move, and then I'll clear the way to the outpost.
Don't<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> worry about me. I can take a few Corrupted; I don't want to be sheltered.

The priests tell me they have seen visions of the realm of Corruption, and though a hellscape it may be, I've come to see the truth of the Tempest's faith.

She says this is the birthright humanity was denied at the dawn of time, that the Ancients here expelled us from this Eden and planted the false mythologies in our minds to keep us in the dark.

The so-called Corruption is not some fiendish terror but rather the gift of godhead that we will now share across this island, and across the Earth.

The time of confluence draws near. The portals are almost done. 

They have been placed all around the heights, and shall turn the land red with their glow. It will be glorious, a triumph of engineering and skill, of conquest and battle. 

We shall bring forth reinforcements that this land has never seen. At the highest point to the west shall we rise, and our power will flow out across the land in a crimson wave. 

Never again will we be lost, for we are united in our purpose.
The outpost is ours, and if we can secure it, we<g id="female_nodConsider" /> might be able to stage sorties from here to the Crimson mountain itself.
This outpost is beyond<g id="male_goodnews" /> the scope of what we planned,<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> but I believe it will yield great value in our longer campaign against the Corrupted.
If your<g id="male_gestureForwardLefthand" /> attacks on the nearby forts were successful, I believe we are secure here.
Mounting An Attack
Follow the route of the ore through the mountain road and destroy any Unfinished Portals.
Travel along {POITags} to destroy Unfinished Portals
Destroy the first Unfinished Portal
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Destroy the second Unfinished Portal
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Destroy the third Unfinished Portal
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Destroy the fourth Unfinished Portal
Defeat {targetName} enemies
Destroy the fifth Unfinished Portal
Defeat {targetName} enemies

<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />We left some Wardens to maintain the eastern outpost,<g id="female_explainS" /> but brought most of the others here. Warden Yash was<g id="male_chuckle" /> quite proud to be the one to secure the location.
It seems<g id="male_laugh" /> he never even realized he had become cut off.
"Where is Yash now?"
He's gone off with Yonas, and<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> you should follow with haste. The ore trail leads up into the Ancient ruins on the western peaks.
It's clear that<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> this Commander Thorpe is constructing his evil portals up there.
"They're already gone?"
Yes, you know how stubborn<g id="male_lookaroundBored" /> Yonas can be, and as his vigor has increased, so has his thirst for battle.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I fear the old man could get himself and<g id="female_youknowS" /> the other Wardens in over their heads. You should catch up as soon as possible.
<g id="male_nodMild" />I'll remain here and ensure this location is secure and you<g id="male_salute2Fingers" /> and your Wardens are not attacked from behind.
<g id="male_nodMild" />No matter how urgent the need to get to the peak, we cannot<g id="female_liftHandsXs" /> leave our fellow Wardens behind.
I am proud<g id="female_cheerFistpump" /> to be making a stand against the Corrupted, but I think I need more training before another mission like this one.
And who is the destroyer now? I seek to create! Your former captain is only one such project! Go, then. Test yourself on him.
And who is the destroyer now?
I seek to create! Your former captain is only one such project!
Go, then. Test yourself on him.
We should have waited for you before<g id="yonas_lookleft" /> embarking on this mission. For once, Galahad was right.
<g id="yonas_throwarmsFrustrated" />Blast it all! I am<g id="yonas_handsExtendedSorry" /> sorry, young one. I hoped to share some of the burden that has been so unevenly put on you.
<g id="yonas_shakehead" />Galahad urged patience, and<g id="yonas_lookaroundAfraid" /> he was right. I fear I've led our fellow Wardens into danger once again.
Beyond the Gates
Rescue the captured Soulwardens, push on to the top of the mountain, confront Thorpe, and close the portal to Corruption.
Defeat {targetName}
Rescue O-fusa Matsui
Rescue Jacquet Davy
Defeat {targetName}
Continue on to {POITags}
Stop Thorpe's Plans
Talk to Yash
Enter the plane of Corruption
Defeat {targetName}
Leave the plane of Corruption
Fix the Corrupted Shrine
Use the Corrupted Shrine
Meet with Yonas and the Soulwardens
<g id="yonas_lefthand" />We fought valiantly and managed to destroy some of the portals, but<g id="yonas_headshakeDisappointed" /> the Corrupted sent reinforcements and we were overwhelmed.
A<g id="yonas_lookdownGuilt" /> few of us managed to escape, but others have once again become captured.
"Then we'll rescue them again."

Yes,<g id="yonas_noddingSubtle" /> but Warden Yash places too much faith<g id="yonas_shiftWeight" /> in me, I fear. He escaped as well<g id="yonas_righthand02" /> and ranges ahead to assess the enemy position.
So charge<g id="yonas_fistsmack" /> on, rescue those captured, find Yash, and lets get to the peak.<g id="yonas_lefthand" /> I'll be right behind you.
Together we are stronger<g id="yonas_gestureForward" /> than anything Corruption sends our way.

<g id="female_explainS" />Our Heartgems… they're not strong enough up here.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Several Wardens have succumbed to Corruption.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> I'm afraid… if we push on, will we all share their fate?
"Stay strong. We can do this."

<g id="male_nodMild" />With you here, my hopes are renewed,<g id="female_explainS" /> we can't allow them to take any more captive.<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> Our strength lies in the trust we have with our team.
<g id="female_smackfist" />I shall stand strong, and we will get through this.

<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />When I saw the others fall, it just sapped the last hope from me.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I can't fight my former friends… I would rather… give up.<g id="female_youknowS" /> Tell me you understand.
"I get it, but we must fight on."

<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Yes… yes. You're right, I must stand firm against the fallen,<g id="female_gestureRightM" /> even if they were dear friends.<g id="male_nodMild" /> We must defeat them to protect those of us who remain.
Lead on. My resolve is restored. I won't let the past get in the way of the present.
<g id="yonas_realize" />I fear whatever is on the other side<g id="yonas_leanforwardListensound" /> of that portal… it could very well be a journey with no return.
Well, we made<g id="female_clenchfistsGetpumped" /> it here, at least.<g id="female_youknowS" /> Yonas was determined you wouldn't face this alone.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> He outran me.
But with that portal open, we may<g id="male_dazed" /> be too late. It would seem that any moment now, an army of demons will spew forth.
"There must be a way to close it."
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />Perhaps… on the other side, but… I mean, I consider myself brave, but that<g id="male_dontknow" /> would seem to be venturing into the literal gates of hell.
And what, we<g id="male_giveup" /> leave Commander Thorpe to continue his campaign here?
"I'll go in. You go after Thorpe."
I… is<g id="male_hopeless" /> that our only choice?<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> Very well, I think Yonas needs a moment,<g id="female_explainS" /> but I will get the others and we will give chase.
I<g id="male_bowShallow" /> bow to your sacrifice, Warden, and your courage.<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> If… you do return, come after us.
When I signed on to the Wardens, I<g id="female_crossarms" /> knew it would be a grim war, but this is beyond the pale.

string.comment: All Thorpe IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Captain Thorpe
string.name: CaptainThorpe

resources.string: You defied my orders. This is the price you pay. The gate opens to welcome our allies from beyond, and with them, your doom.
You defied my orders.
This is the price you pay.
The gate opens to welcome our allies from beyond,
And with them... your doom!
You're a fool to keep nipping at my heels, and I tire of it. Let us end this, for once and all.
Do you not see how Corruption empowers me? You're just a bilge rat whose captain must put you down.
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />You… made it back?<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I-I don't know what to say, except… I<g id="male_laugh" /> am glad you're on our side.
Heh, I can't<g id="yonas_lookrightPensive" /> believe I doubted you for even a second… but that portal, I shudder to think of what you may have witnessed in there.
There is no<g id="yonas_handsHipsShakehead" /> time to hear your account, however. Commander Thorpe is calling for reinforcements.
"Reinforcements from where?"
From the north, from the Shattered<g id="yonas_throwarmsFrustrated" /> Mountain itself, and from appearances, it is an army that would engulf this entire region.
Our only hope is to hold<g id="yonas_shiftAwkward" /> them back long enough to destroy the Commander.
To Stand Against The Dark
Talk to Yonas about the plan of battle, then track down and fight Commander Thorpe.
Meet Thorpe on a field of battle
Defeat Thorpe
To Stand Against The Dark
Battle through Thorpe's followers to confront him
To Stand Against The Dark: Stage 1/5
To Stand Against The Dark: Stage 2/5
To Stand Against The Dark: Stage 3/5
To Stand Against The Dark: Stage 4/5
To Stand Against The Dark: Stage 5/5
Harass Thorpe's Supporters
Defeat Thorpe's Loyalists
Defeat Thorpe's Lieutenants
Survive the Invading Swarm
Defeat Commander Thorpe
Intermission
While Yash was scouting<g id="yonas_lookup" /> enemy positions, I have considered and decided how we will do this.
We will<g id="yonas_nod" /> stay here and hold the line against<g id="yonas_crossarmsLeanback" /> the hordes as long as we can - to buy you time to defeat Commander Thorpe.
"There must be another way."

I will<g id="yonas_pointForwardThreaten" /> NOT tolerate your bull-headed arguments this time!<g id="yonas_explain01" /> I'm ordering you to go south and attack Thorpe's camp before reinforcements arrive.
We've<g id="yonas_explain02" /> all agreed on this course, and we are ready to make our stand.
"I'll do my duty. Godspeed, Yonas."
Godspeed to you, as well, my<g id="yonas_saluteFistchest" /> valiant friend. You've brought this old man back from the dead.
I'm more than willing to make this sacrifice, and fear not, I will send the others away before we are overrun. Go now... and quickly!
If our Order is to survive this war, we must defeat Commander Thorpe. We'll<g id="yonas_fisthigh" /> keep the reinforcements out, but the hard fight is on you.
Yonas speaks the truth, and we've<g id="male_handheart" /> all agreed to stay and hold the line here. You're our best hope, and if this is the way it must be, so be it!
Today we strike a blow against Corruption!
We shall give them a taste of our determination!
“And so shall lies be tested, like flaws in a sword." He was... unworthy. Truly, it should've been you at my side.
“And so shall lies be tested, like flaws in a sword.”
He was... unworthy. Truly, it should've been you at my side.
Please<g id="male_giveup" /> tell me it was a success, that it was worth it.
<g id="female_smackfist" />You defeated the bastard,<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> didn't you? Then it was worth it.

<g id="male_convince02" />We held back the reinforcements for an eternity. When all seemed lost, Yonas<g id="male_gestureHereweare" /> fought like no one else I've ever seen. He wasn't a hero, <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />he was a legend.
Wounds Run Deep
Return to the outpost and find supplies to heal Yonas. Meet up with Grace and get word from Caer Dun.
Return to {POITags}
Talk to Grace O'Malley
Search for {itemName}
Search for {itemName}
Search for {itemName}
Talk to Yonas
Talk to Yash

<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />There was a moment when it seemed our position<g id="female_liftHandsXs" /> would be overrun.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Yonas tried to send us away and hold the horde alone.
And he did,<g id="male_lookawayGuilty" /> but he took a grievous wound in the process, and I managed to drag him away.
"Is he alright? Can he be healed?"
Well, he's<g id="female_sighRelief" /> in no danger of dying,<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> but his mind is what I fear for.
Come,<g id="female_beckon" /> let us return to the outpost and find out what medicines are available.<g id="male_explain" /> Hopefully, our efforts restoring the supply lines have not been undone.
I still cannot<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> believe we made it through that. I've never seen so many Corrupted in one place.
We shall stay on, and make sure those Corrupted dogs do not try to build any more portals.
I'll never forgive myself. I vowed to protect my comrades, but Judithe… she won't be returning.
It hasn't been easy, what we have done here. In Judithe's name we shall stay, and make sure it doesn't get any worse.
Well, look at you, straight<g id="grace_bow" /> back from deep behind enemy lines with a hard-fought victory -<g id="grace_gestureRLow" /> and you killed that bastard Captain of yours, no less.
I<g id="grace_gestureAround" /> know there was sacrifice, but all-in-all, I'd call this a lucky day.
"We need to get Yonas healed."
Indeed, lucky<g id="grace_laughcocky" /> you had a smuggler like your friend Grace running supplies. Those supply lines were about as safe as a den of vipers!
Just want it on record I'm<g id="grace_handheart" /> doing my part, especially if it comes to counting spoils.
<g id="g_female_leanforwardlistennod" />Mmm. They tell me you defeated the<g id="g_female_lookdownguilty" /> Commander. That's good. I told you we'd keep those reinforcements off your back, didn't I?
"You did, and you delivered."
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />We did, didn't we…? Alright then,<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" /> you all can stop hovering over me with bandages and potions. I don't need them.
<g id="g_male_waghand02" />I'm an old soldier, and I've healed from worse than this. Just need some rest.
Let me rest. Some time alone will do what potions and bandages cannot.
I'm<g id="male_converseright" /> glad to see Yonas is talking, at least.<g id="male_nodMild" /> That's an improvement.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Did you give him the medicine?
"He won't take it."

Bah, give<g id="female_takeitem" /> it to me!<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I'll get the old man to listen to reason,<g id="male_convince02" /> and if not, I'll pour it down his throat when he's sleeping.
We need<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> to get him well enough to<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> get him back to Caer Dun.
I'm going<g id="female_worry" /> to make sure Yonas takes all the medicine he needs. He's got to get better!
Did<g id="grace_shrugDontknow" /> you find what you need among the supplies?
Well now, there's no<g id="grace_proud" /> need to shower me with gratitude and gold, I'm just doing my part for the Soulwardens.
I<g id="grace_consider" /> trust the medicines I brought are good enough to do the job?
"Yonas needs to use them."
Ah, leave<g id="grace_dismiss" /> that to Warden Yash, that fellow's the type to make even the most troublesome sheep take their medicine.
Besides if the old man has<g id="grace_chuckle" /> enough energy to argue, I'm sure he'll be fine.
A Better Defense
Shore up the defenses of Caer Dun to protect against future attacks.
Return to {POITags}
Talk to Galahad about the fort's defenses
Collect {itemName} from the Log Pile
Collect {itemName} from the Stone Pile
Make the first northern barricade
Make the second northern barricade
Collect {itemName} from the Log Pile
Collect {itemName} from the Stone Pile
Make the first southern barricade
Make the second southern barricade
Check on Yonas
Now<g id="grace_cajole" /> that we got the old man all sorted out, we have other matters to discuss.
Your friend Morgaine came to Caer Dun and<g id="grace_think" /> stirred up a hornet's nest of debate. She and Alchemist Sun have very different ideas about things.
"What kind of ideas?"
Well,<g id="grace_gestureAround" /> Morgaine came into the command tent, saying something about using the Angry Earth Blight in Edengrove to fight Corruption.
Alchemist Sun didn't<g id="grace_laughCover" /> appreciate the notion so much, and they went at it.
"I should get back to Caer Dun."
<g id="grace_worry" />You should, before those proud ladies come to blows. I did my best, but<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" /> I'm not cut out to be a peacemaker.
And<g id="grace_pshaw" /> just be prepared, Galahad's gone back as well, promising to set Morgaine straight,<g id="grace_laughS" /> so should be fun! Good luck!
Now<g id="grace_secret" /> that I'm here, it would be shame not to at least duck my head into some of these ruins.
Excellent<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" /> to see you, Soulwarden.<g id="female_explainS" /> I heard of your success before I departed, and that's part of why I'm here.
We must not<g id="male_spreadhands" /> let our victories spoil us, and after the gains in Great Cleave,<g id="male_convince02" /> we must fortify our positions.
"I heard Morgaine was here."
<g id="male_nodMild" />She was. The<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" /> sorceress wasted not a moment before arguing with Sun about the Angry Earth.
<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Morgaine left in a huff, but<g id="male_explain" /> Sun's gone after her. My focus now is to ensure the Wardens here were not too discouraged.
"Was morale here affected?"
Not<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> seriously. I've been critical of Yonas, but he has recruited and inspired many brave new Wardens.
<g id="female_youknowS" />If you're willing, however, I believe your<g id="male_convince02" /> help constructing new barricades would be useful and inspiring to them.
With luck, and<g id="male_lookUpAround" /> a little work, we'll<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> have this fortress more secure than ever in no time at all.

<g id="g_male_pointblame" bout="2" />It's a little cruel to make a wounded old man come all the way<g id="g_female_leanforwardlistennod" bin="2" /> back here just to deliver a message, don't you think?
Heh.<g id="g_female_nodshrugokay" /> I'm glad to say I'm feeling somewhat restored<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> thanks to you and Warden Yash.
"Why are you here?"
Because you're<g id="yonas_gestureForward" /> needed back at Eastmarch. Herbalist Sun Fuchun awaits you there, and she's distraught.

<g id="g_male_leanforwardinspect" />Can't say I fully understand, but<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" /> that's the message, and now I must rest.<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" bout="2" /> Can't let Galahad do more work than me.
There is a war brewing<g id="g_female_handsonhipsshakehead" /> that will catch us all. Some of the others don't see it, but I know you do.
There you are! We<g id="female_beckon" /> need to go to Edengrove, you and I.
Your sorceress friend, Morgaine, has concocted<g id="male_convince02" /> a very dangerous plan, and I need your help talking her out of it.
